Title:
No longer monotypic: First record of the Hausknechtia
(Psathyrellaceae, Agaricales) from China with description a new species
and re-description of genus
Keywords:
a new taxon, Agaricales, Basidiomycete, phylogenetic
analysis, taxonomy
Abstract:
Hausknechtia is newly recorded genus to China, and a new
specie, H.sinensis, is here described, based on traditional
morphological and phylogenetic analyses. H.sinensis is characterized by
small basidiomata, pileus strongly sulcate when young, ellipsoidal to
long ellipsoidal spores, germ pore absent, cheilocystidia present and
pleurocystidia absent. Phylogenetic analyses of three-gene (ITS, LSU and
tef-1α) show that H.sinensis forms a distinct lineage and group together
with H.floriformis in the Hausknechtia by Maximum Likelihood and
Bayesian methods. Due to characteristics of H.sinensis conflict with
Wächter & Melzers description of Hausknechtia, the description of
Hausknechtia was emended. The detailed description, color photos,
illustrations in the paper are presented.
